comments.body: I wonder if we should go the other way and call them "opaque types" everywhere since "opaque type aliases" is a bit of mouthful and less commonly used in my experience. But any consistency is good!

_Opaque type alias_ is surely a bit more precise but I would not mind to use opaque type as one has to look up what it means in any case I guess.. Other pages use opaque type already. I could do a search replace once we agree on one of the two (or something else).
Just asked around at the lab and people seemed to prefer "opaque type aliases" so let's keep it that way :).

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +81,85 @@}
```
The `Access` object defines three opaque type aliases:

 - `Permission`, representing a single permission,
